intro: Leptospermum crassifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved tea tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its aromatic oils and has been used in traditional Aboriginal medicine. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various native fauna.
